reference_summary:
The Life of Birds
Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
["The definitive series on the most colorful, popular and perfectly adapted creatures on earth, The Life of Birds traverses the globe, covering 42 countries and examining over 300 different species. Calling upon the immense skills of many of the world's top wildlife cameramen and women, and pushing filming technology to the limits, new behavior is brought to the screen in staggering detail. Infra-red cameras find oilbirds deep in pitch black caves. Ultra slow motion film unravels the complexities of bird flight and ultraviolet cameras reveal the world from a bird's point of view."]

This was purchased as a gift and was greatly appreciated.  It is always exciting to give something that can be enjoyed by the whole family over and over.
Makes a great gift!

This is one of those classic love stories that you just can't stop watching, over, and over.  You get a true feel for this historical period, without the Hollywood glitter and glamor we so often see. One of my favorite movies.
A true classic!
Cayman Went
Michael Lombardi  (Actor),     Jeff Demunn  (Actor),     Bobby Sheehan  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
['TV personality Josh Anders (Michael Lombardi, FX’s Rescue Me) is a legend in his own mind … and even he has doubts. Ratings are down and the hottie star of Diver Down (a male Baywatch) can’t get arrested in Hollywood these days. When the smug pretty boy receives an ultimatum from an ultra-wealthy, powerful andunethical resort developer – who also happens to own the network that broadcasts his show – Josh finds himself the key player in a land grab scheme targeting the picturesque, unspoiled and tiny Caribbean island of Cayman Brac.The laid-back locals, most of them big fans, are putty in his hands, except for theeccentric Mr. Bowman (Jeffrey Demunn, Burn After Reading, Hollywoodland, CBS’s Law & Order, The Shawshank Redemption), a cranky retiree who’s never even heard of the show.Secretly petrified of the ocean, Josh just wants to close the deal and go home. That is until Mr. Bowman, a parentless kid named Rodney and Darby Thomas (Susan Misner,Chicago, Eavesdrop), the beautiful but opinionated owner of the local Sand Bar, change his mind about what really matters most.A romantic drama that proves It’s all good … if you just know what to look for.']

nice story

Ant-Man (1-Disc DVD)
Paul Rudd  (Actor, Writer),     Evangeline Lilly  (Actor),     Peyton Reed  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
["The next evolution of the Marvel Cinematic Universe harnesses the tiniest but mightiest force know to man and introduces the newest member of the Avengers: MARVEL'S ANT-MAN. Armed with the amazing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, master thief Scott Lang joins forces with his new mentor Dr. Hank Pym to protect the secret behind his spectacular Ant-Man suit from ruthless villains! With humanity's fate in the balance, Pym and Lang must plan and pull off a daring heist against insurmountable odds. Filled with humor, awesome special effects and exclusive bonus features, this action-packed adventure takes you to new levels of pulse-pounding excitement!"]

Loved this movie when I saw It in the theater, so had to buy it to add to my collection.  I enjoy that this movie takes time to develop the characters, has a great sense of humor, and the action scenes with the Ants are very cool.  Great movie for the whole family to watch.
Great family movie.
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
Science Fiction, Comedy, Charming, Exciting
['When NY City is in trouble, it’s up to the four ninja-fighting, pizza-loving brothers to save it. Aided by determined reporter April O’Neil and their wise master Splinter, these unlikely heroes must face their ultimate nemesis - the evil Shredder.']

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Focus**: The user exhibits a strong passion for documentary films on nature and wildlife, classic love stories with historical context, and family-friendly action films that blend humor with engaging character development. They enjoy adaptations of beloved characters, particularly when executed with charm and excitement.

- **Preferred Format**: The user continues to favor DVDs, especially multi-format or collector's editions, seeking high-quality productions that enhance their viewing experience.

- **Target Audience**: Family-oriented content remains a priority, with an emphasis on films that resonate across age groups for enjoyable shared experiences. Their recent reviews show an increasing scrutiny towards films that do not meet their standards for engagement and narrative.

- **Gift-Giving**: The user values thoughtful gifts that provide both education and entertainment, prioritizing meaningful connections in their selections.

- **Quality Appreciation**: This user has a discerning taste for remakes and adaptations, favoring titles with strong narratives and character development. They expressed some disappointment in a recent adaptation, noting that certain character portrayals fell short of expectations, yet they still found enjoyment in the overall story.

- **Emotional Engagement**: Family bonding is essential, but the user is becoming more critical of poorly executed content in their preferred genres. They actively seek quality viewing options that deliver engaging storytelling and high production quality.

- **Overall Ratings**: While generally positive, their evaluations indicate rising standards, with a willingness to express disappointment when a film fails to connect, demonstrating an increasingly selective approach to viewing preferences.
